panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx, Disk IO rates) for a selected virtual machine over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VMs Disk Read_Rate, Write_Rate Usage
-- over time.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    COALESCE (
        disk_name,
        MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    ) AS disk_name,
    AVG ( Read_Rate ) AS Read_Rate,
    AVG ( Write_Rate ) AS Write_Rate
FROM (
    SELECT
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN vm_disk_name
            ELSE
                vm_disk_name
                ||
                '*'
        END AS disk_name,
        history_datetime AS Time,
        MAX (
            ROUND (
                CAST (
                    COALESCE (
                        read_rate_bytes_per_second,
                        0
                    )
                    AS FLOAT
                ) ::numeric /
                ( 1024 * 1024 ),
                1
            )
        ) AS Read_Rate,
        MAX (
            ROUND (
                CAST (
                    COALESCE (
                        write_rate_bytes_per_second,
                        0
                    )
                    AS FLOAT
                ) ::numeric /
                ( 1024 * 1024 ),
                1
            )
        ) AS Write_Rate
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly.vm_disk_id
            )
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we filter by the latest vms_disks  configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a
            GROUP BY a.vm_disk_id
        )
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id IN (
            SELECT c.vm_disk_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly AS b
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks AS c
                    ON (
                        c.vm_disk_id = b.vm_disk_id
                    )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by active vms disks only
                b.vm_disk_status = 1
                AND c.vm_disk_id IN (
                    SELECT device_id
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices
                        INNER JOIN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                            ON (
                                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_configuration_version =
                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                            )
                    WHERE
                        -- Here we filter by active vms only
                        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
                        -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id in($vm_id)
                        AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                        AND (
                            delete_date > $__timeFrom()
                            OR
                            delete_date IS NULL
                        )
                        -- Here we get the latest vm_devices configuration
                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id IN (
                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                            GROUP BY
                                a.vm_id,
                                a.device_id
                        )
                        -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                        -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                        AND
                            CASE
                              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                              THEN 1=1
                              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                              THEN delete_date isnull
                            END
                )
                AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                -- Here we get the latest vm_disks configuration
                AND c.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                    FROM  v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                    GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted VM disks according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                AND
                    CASE
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                      THEN 1=1
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                      THEN delete_date isnull
                    END
            GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
            -- Here we sort by the disks that have the max read and write rate.
            ORDER BY
                MAX (
                    ROUND (
                        CAST (
                            COALESCE (
                                b.read_rate_bytes_per_second,
                                0
                            )
                            AS FLOAT
                        ) ::numeric,
                        1
                    )
                ) +
                MAX (
                    ROUND (
                        CAST (
                            COALESCE (
                                b.write_rate_bytes_per_second,
                                0
                            )
                            AS FLOAT
                        ) ::numeric,
                        1
                    )
                ) DESC
            LIMIT 5
        )
        -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
        -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly.vm_disk_id,
        disk_name, history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    a.time,
    disk_name
ORDER BY
    a.time,
    COALESCE (
        disk_name,
        MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    )

panels.title: Single Virtual Machine Resources - Disk IO rates (Over Time) (BR10A)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx, Disk IO rates) for a selected virtual machine over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
--  VMs Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates
-- over time.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    COALESCE (
        interface_name,
        MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    ) AS interface_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS Rx_rate,
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS Tx_rate
FROM (
    SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
            ELSE
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                ||
                '*'
        END AS interface_name,
        history_datetime AS time,
        AVG (
            COALESCE (
                receive_rate_percent, 0
            )
        ) AS Rx_rate,
        AVG (
            COALESCE (
                transmit_rate_percent,
                0
            )
        ) AS Tx_rate
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly.vm_interface_id
            )
    WHERE history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest vm_interfaces configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS a
            GROUP BY a.vm_interface_id
        )
        -- Here we get or remove deleted vm_interfaces according to what the user chose
        -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN delete_date isnull
            END
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id IN (
            SELECT c.vm_interface_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly AS b
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS c
                    ON (
                        c.vm_interface_id = b.vm_interface_id
                    )
                INNER JOIN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly d
                    ON (
                        d.vm_configuration_version =
                        c.vm_configuration_version
                        AND
                        d.history_datetime =
                        b.history_datetime
                    )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by active vms only
                d.vm_status = 1
                AND c.vm_interface_id IN (
                    -- Here we filter by the VM chosen by the user
                    SELECT device_id
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices
                    WHERE
                        vm_id in($vm_id)
                        AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                        AND (
                            delete_date > $__timeFrom()
                            OR
                            delete_date IS NULL
                        )
                        -- Here we get the latest vm_devices configuration
                        AND history_id IN (
                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices AS a
                            GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                        )
                        -- Here we get or remove deleted VMs according to what the user chose
                        -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                        AND
                            CASE
                              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                              THEN 1=1
                              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                              THEN delete_date isnull
                            END
                )
                AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                AND c.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS d
                    GROUP BY d.vm_interface_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted vm_interfaces according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                AND
                    CASE
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                      THEN 1=1
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                      THEN delete_date isnull
                    END
            GROUP BY c.vm_interface_id
            ORDER BY
                AVG (
                    COALESCE (
                        b.receive_rate_percent,
                        0
                    )
                ) +
                AVG (
                    COALESCE (
                        b.transmit_rate_percent,
                        0
                    )
                ) DESC
            LIMIT 3
        )
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
        interface_name,
        history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    a.time,
    interface_name
ORDER BY a.time ASC

panels.title: Single Virtual Machine Resources - Network Tx/Rx (Over Time) (BR10A)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx, Disk IO rates) for a selected virtual machine over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VMs Max and Average MEMory Usage Peaks
-- over time.

SELECT
    $__time(time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Memory Usage",
    MEM_Peak AS "Memory Peak"
FROM (
    -- VMs Max and Average MEMory Usage Peaks
    SELECT
        history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                memory_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                max_memory_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Peak
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active vms only
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id in($vm_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    GROUP BY
        history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    time,
    MEM_Usage,
    MEM_Peak
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Single Virtual Machine Resources - Memory (Over Time) (BR10A)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx, Disk IO rates) for a selected virtual machine over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VMs Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
-- over time.

SELECT
    $__time(a.time),
    CPU_Usage,
    CPU_Peak
FROM (
    -- Here we get the vms Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
    SELECT
        history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                cpu_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                max_cpu_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Peak
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active vms only
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id in($vm_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    GROUP BY history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    a.time,
    CPU_Usage,
    CPU_Peak
ORDER BY a.time

panels.title: Single Virtual Machine Resources - CPU (Over Time) (BR10A)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT vm_name AS __text , vm_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms WHERE cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')
list.label: Virtual Machine
list.name: vm_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT vm_name AS __text , vm_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms WHERE cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')
